intro: Hoya attenuata, commonly known as the wax plant or sweetheart plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and clusters of waxy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white, pink, or red. Hoya attenuata is a climbing or trailing plant that thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is popular as a decorative houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
